rComments: Want to be challenged and learn from a specialist in this field? This class is for you. Otherwise? Look elsewhere. This class offers a symbiosis between theoretical lectures and hands-on applications in assignments/class prompts. Incredibly challenging assignments (and Christoph is a hard marker) but so rewarding. I left knowing so much more.
Very very difficult marker. Smart guy but has no helpful guidelines for assignments, and expects too much.

Amazing prof!! He really knows what hes talking about but is very specific about doing things his way. However, hes approachable and very helpful. Theres a lot of content to take in and he's a fast talker so be ready to takes quickly as the course is designed very smartly so that the assignments cover everything he covers in class. Generous grader!

If you want a professor who cares about you learning something, he's great. if you're just looking for an easy credit, look somewhere else. Almost encyclopedic knowledge of his subject and eager to share, but expects you to keep up - hey, it's grad school, right? Hardest challenge: his assignments are short, but you have to provide a lot of info.

There is a lot of information being provided in class but non of them are clarified. Does not know the requirement for assignment, no template to follow and no clear outlines. All he says is require what is need to be clear. He DOES NOT give clear answers and get bad grades because he doesn't like your answer.

This course was awful. 3 hours straight; on average 120 or slides a class that weren't posted online beforehand. Seemed to hate being distracted from his slides with questions. Sadly even the slides weren't original, taken from random places online. A LOT OF INFORMATION. Zero clarity. Incredibly hard marker to boot!

Christoph is very knowledgable. However, it is hard to describe how problematic he is as a professor. There's a fine line between having reasonable expectations at the graduate level and being strict, and Christoph is very harsh in that respect. He is also a very hard marker -- the hardest I have ever had in graduate school. Avoid him if you can.
